summary: This document contains selected pages from the deposition of William C. Sturbitts, a CIA employee, taken on April 16, 1975, by the Rockefeller Commission. The deposition covers topics such as anti-Castro activities, CIA clandestine operations, Cuban exiles, and the roles of various individuals including Desmond Fitzgerald, Frank Sturgis, E. Howard Hunt, Robert F. Kennedy, Johnny Roselli, and Sam Giancana. Sturbitts discusses his involvement in Cuban operations, his knowledge of discussions regarding possible assassination attempts against Fidel Castro, and the CIA's relationship with individuals involved in anti-Castro efforts.
title: Deposition of (A CIA Employee)
